Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: cat

Arguments.Name: b
Arguments.Description: Number the non-blank output lines, starting at 1

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: Display non-printing characters (see the -v option), and display a dollar sign (‘$’) at the end of each line

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Set an exclusive advisory lock on the standard output file descriptor.  This lock is set using fcntl(2) with the F_SETLKW command. If the output file is already locked, cat will block until the lock is acquired

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Number the output lines, starting at 1

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Squeeze multiple adjacent empty lines, causing the output to be single spaced

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: Display non-printing characters (see the -v option), and display tab characters as ‘^I’

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Display non-printing characters so they are visible.  Control characters print as ‘^X’ for control-X; the delete character (octal 0177) prints as ‘^?’.  Non-ASCII characters (with the high bit set) are printed as ‘M-’ (for meta) followed by the character for the low 7 bits
